column5: A website dedicated to the availability of items posted on kijiji. For those who don't really want the product or necessarily have any money to their name, but would still like to know anonymously if products are still for sale. Now you can follow an item, without having the annoying responses from the seller asking 'are you still interested'?  I may add a second section dedicated to the 'lowest price i'll accept', for those have very little to do during the day, but have a burning desire to know what someone's base price is.   What do you guys think??? Big money in my future?

I would say that it would be nearly impossible, for these 2 reasons,  1: that would require the seller to be proactive on their ad, and actually take it down when the item sells  2: the sellers lowest price isn't what they think it is, negotiations are different with everyone
Could you add a section to track the people who say "on my way over now" but never show up? I'm sure their families would appreciate the closure
Nobody spilling stuff lately Chad?  Seems like you found a minute or two with nothing to do....   Michael
Kijiji already had an app for that.

I already quit my job to pursue this idea! Haha  This was more of a sarcastic/venting post. I can't count how many people have asked if an item is available, then I say yes, and then there are no further responses.

You already can create a watchlist on kijiji.  All the ads you're interested in are in one place.  You don't need to contact the buyer unless you want to make an offer.  When the poster removes the item it disappears from the list.

I already quit my job to pursue this idea! Haha  This was more of a sarcastic/venting post. I can't count how many people have asked if an item is available, then I say yes, and then there are no further responses. Figured something like that - you forgot to put the option in for them to overpay you, then you ship them the stuff and send them the change ...  and have the original payment be a fraud so yer out the goods, the shipping and the "change".  Michael
